title: (2012) Islamic Diversity in Thailand’s far-south. Paper presented at Religion, Business and Contestation in Southeat Asia. UM  June 27-28, 2012
summary: This paper describes the movements, personalities and processes in Thailand’s Malay dominated provinces of Pattani, Yala, and Narathiwat that have led to unprecedented diversity within the ummah. Like the rest of Thai/Malay peninsula, although the overwhelming majority of Muslims in Thailand’s far-south are conservative traditionalists, the size and influence reformist Islam continues to increase. This is particularly the case among urban Malays. While the roots of reformism were sown in the 19th century by luminaries such as Syeikh Daud al-Fatani (1769-1847), and Syeikh Ahmed al-Fatani (1856-1908), the most important reformist personality in the early 20th centuries was Haji Sulong (1895-1945). Since his return from Saudi Arabia in the 1990s, Dr Ismail Lutfi Japakiya, the founding of rector of Yala Islamic University (Thailand’s first Islamic university) has emerged as the leader of Saudi style salafism. I conclude by considering the impact of the Tablighi Jama’at, a South Asian revival movement, on Islamic diversity in South Thailand since its arrival in the 1980s. A important point infrequently made in analysis of the Tablighi Jama’at is that both reformists and traditionalists are involved in this important revivalist movement.

title: An analysis and reflection on Malay Medical Manuscripts found in Malaysian Libraries
summary:
This paper presents a comparison of Malay medical knowledge with Galenic-Avicennan Medicine and show how there are similarities between the two. The paper would be able to situate the kitab tibb genre within the literary system which is found in the Islamic civilization which is a continuation of that highly advanced unani medicine system instead of viewing the Kitab Tibb as a mere past-time or hotch-podge remedy concocted from old wives' tales and superstitious beliefs which unfortunately is how it is viewed by many. In my study of 80 plus writings which can roughly be classified under Tibb I have found that many are just notes. There are hardly any similarities in regards to prescriptions. In my study of prescriptions for 4 types of diseases or illnesses I have found that very-very few exhibit similar prescriptions between the 80plus tibb works in Malay. How are we to interpret such data? If these are just the scribe’s notes and that scribe is the medical practitioner then what are we to make of such data? According to Sweeney(1980), Malay writings are mainly reproduction of the oral tradition then what are we to make of these findings? Various studies has been advanced in the past such as by Gimlette, Werner, Harun Mat Piah, Taib Osman etc and they have all contributed towards our understanding of the Tibb from various perspectives. Gimlette for instance had compiled a list of prescription from Malay medicine in his dictionary (1923); Taib Osman had furnished us with an understanding of Malay worldview which he argued is influenced by Hindu-Buddhist as well as Islamic teachings. Werner’s work is quite interesting for his interest lies in alternative medicine and he had dedicated his life into documenting and writing about various alternative remedies and prescriptions given by aboriginal medicine as well as Malay medicine. His main contribution to Malay medicine is his book documenting a Malay medicine practitioner Che Dir who was also the Sultan of Kelantan’s family doctor. Werner had documented and translated Che Dir’s notebook and within I we get a near contemporary understanding of Malay medicine as it was practiced at the court of a 20th century state. It is in his documentation that we find many interesting points which contribute towards a better understanding of Malay medicine as it was and still is being practiced in Malaysia. In my own study which looked at Malay medicine mainly from manuscripts of the 19th century I have come to a few conclusions. First the texts and prescriptions within them are varied even when it is for the same illness or ailment e.g. stomachache. Second the texts are varied and are mainly notes. I have found only a handful that deal with the nature of medicine and explanation on how to become a medicine man. Most of the other manuscripts deal directly with prescriptions one after another. Thirdly the influence of Quranic verses as supplementary methods of treatment are immense that one would discount even the influence of Hindu-Buddhist from many of the manuscripts. I will try and explore some of these in the paper as well as present an overview of the 80 plus manuscripts which I have encountered. 
Keywords: Malay medicine, Malay manuscripts, philosophy of Malay medicine

title: Pemikiran Epistemologi Melayu melalui pembacaan manuskrip terpilih, suatu pendekatan sistematis-historis
summary:
Makalah ini akan cuba memberikan suatu konsepsi awal terhadap beberapa isu berkait dengan epistemology Melayu sepanjang zaman. Melayu sebagai rumpun bangsa yang terbesar di Asia Tenggara (melebihi 300 juta orang) mempunyai suatu pandangan hidup dan budaya yang telah bertahan selama ribuan tahun. Sejak tahun 70an cara pandangan alam telah diberikan penekanan oleh pemikir-pemikir Melayu melalui penulisan mereka. Idea penekanan terhadap aspek agama diberikan penekanan yang kuat kepada identity Melayu itu tadi. Identiti Melayu tergabung dari kepelbagaian cara pandang dan budaya amalan orang Melayu. Memahami apakah epistemology Melayu secara zaman berzaman merupakan suatu projek yang besar kerana ia akan melibatkan agar kita melihat secara sistematis dan kritikal kepada perkembangan setiap zaman. Beberapa contoh manuskrip akan ditelaah sebagai representatif kepada setiap zaman. Di dalam makalah ini saya akan memberikan suatu analisa awal kepada beberap manuskrip tasawwuf pada abad ke-16 dan 17. Pemerhatian ini akan cuba mensintesiskan suatu pemikiran epistemology Melayu masa tersebut. Dalam hal ini peranan yang dimainkan adalah sebagai seorang sejarawan idea (historian of ideas) yang menggunakan falsafah dan pendekatan fenomenologi (phenomenology). Saya akan cuba mentafsir secara sistematik agar suatu pandangan mengenai epistemology dapat digarap daripada beberapa manuskrip abad tersebut. [Pendekatan yang diambil adalah berdasarkan kepada metod yang digunakan oleh Havelock dalam mencatat pemikiran dan epistemology Yunani. Sebab pendekatan ini digunakan adalah kerana masyarakat Yunani juga mengalami perubahan dari sifat oral kepada persuratan atau penulisan. Tugas ilmuan kini adalah memahami apakah itu epistemology dan bukannya menghasilkan suatu epistemology baharu yang belum tentu diterima masyarakat kerana mengenepikan aspek sejarah dan keadaan masyarakat]. 

Kata kunci: epistemology, Melayu, nafs, wujūd, yaqīn
